children.subject: <md>I'm not sure if this helps a little bit, but I am a eecs transfer (will graduate in the Spring of 2022) and just finished my first semester at UC Berkeley. I got many interviews for internship during the Fall of 2020 despite having only CS 61a on my resume, and managed to secure one at a unicorn startup in November. I also applied for some internship positions in the Fall of 2021, and also got some interviews. As a result, I think you'll be fine for the Summer of 2021, and Fall of 2021, but you need to start applying now. I'm also sure that you will be able to get internships in the Spring of 2022 and Summer of 2022 if you're allowed take an extra semester. Not sure if it's possible to land an internship after you're forced to graduate though. </md>

history.content:
<md>So I am in a weird spot when it comes to applying for internships this year. I am a soon to be graduating senior (fall21 or spring22) and I just declared cs this past semester. I wanted to apply to internships this fall, but I was wondering if I can still get an internship despite graduating during application season? 

I know I'm applying late for internships, but I had a last min change of heart for my major. Would companies still hire me as an intern? And would this affect my chances of getting an internship?</md>
history.subject: Applying for internship right before graduation?
